basic.description: This seminar course examines public and private aspects of the regulation of international financial activity. On the public side, it examines the globalization of finance and the efforts that have been made toward the international supervision and regulation of banking. On the private side, it examines i) the structure and process of offshore banking and finance and ii) the common law rules and other regulations that govern offshore banking and financing activity. (To be offered jointly with LAW-544.) Not offered 2010-2011.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Intern'l Law And Regulation
